result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on October 9, 2017 at 10:30 am.

9:30 Defendant Brian Peter Anglin in court with attorney Matthew Krische, both appeared via phone.  William Harold Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 15CF52 heard at this time. Court goes over the Defendant's right to be present in person in court.   Court finds defendant freely, intelligently, knowingly, and understandingly made and waives constitutional right to be present in person in court. Thorie: 15CF52 guilty to Ct1 and Ct2, dismiss Ct#3 and 4. 15CF38 dismissed. 3 Dunn County matters will be dismissed and to be considered by this court for sentencing and restitution. Requests PSI.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Def pleas guilty to Ct#1 and Ct#2 in 15CF52; Krische stipulates a factual basis.   COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS. Court finds and adjudicates Def guilty to Ct#1 and Ct#2 in 15CF52. Dismiss but read in Ct#3 and #4 in 15CF52 and dismiss but read in 15CF38. Court orders PSI due within 60 days. Court requires the Def to cooperate with the PSI preparation. 9:50
Plea hearing on August 3, 2017 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Brian Peter Anglin in court with attorney John M. O'Boyle.  Defendant Brian Peter Anglin in custody.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion to amend cash bonds into signature bonds filed by Atty OBoyle. To include 15CF52. Thorie: high end signature bond on both files. Must live with Uncle, not drink, no contact with victins or initiating contact with any minor children, and take medication as prescribed and seek counseling. OBoyle agrees. Court converts bonds to a signature bond. Discussion is held about bond condition with minors. Attorney's agree to condition and understand intention. Defendant Brian Peter Anglin in court with attorney John M. O'Boyle.  Defendant Brian Peter Anglin in custody.  William Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 3:42 pm 
Defendant Brian Peter Anglin in court  VIA VIDEO CONFERENCING FROM PCJ with attorney Liesl E. Nelson  VIA VIDEO CONFERENCING FROM PCJ.  Defendant Brian Peter Anglin in custody.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant has copy of complaint  Charges read to the defendant - complaint read to the defendant.   by the Court Commissioner.  Defendant waives reading of the complaint  Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.  Thorie asks for $20,000 cash bond.  Atty Nelson asks for signature bond.  He has been in Pierce Co for several years.  Thorie responds.  This def threatened the victim with physical harm.  State resumes it request for cash and the no contacts.  Nelson addresses the NO CONTACT provisions.  Def will move to Ashland with his parents.  NOT A VET  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 27, 2015 at 11:00 am.
